awd_titl_txt: The Rise and Fall of the General Electric Corporation       Computer Division
awd_abstract_narration: 9322303  Lee    This award is to provide funds for studying the lifetime of the Computer Division of the General Electric Corporation from its establishment in 1956 to its sale to Honeywell Information Systems in 1968.  It is the intent of this work to create a case study reviewing the interaction between the technological and management activities of these twelve years and to evaluate the reasons for the demise of this division.  The research involves interviewing some key pioneers, top executives, technical and administrative personnel of the corporation.  A full report of this case study will provide some insights to the factors relating to the success and failure of the Computer Division.  ***
